definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: I did something bad with a married guy.
sentences.chinese: 我跟有妇之夫在一起做了不好的事。

sentences.english: As a married man, he has to think of his family.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个有妇之夫，他必须考虑他的家庭。

sentences.english: The young man is a married person now.
sentences.chinese: 那个年轻人现在是有妇之夫了。

sentences.english: She's been fooling around with a married man.
sentences.chinese: 她一直和一个有妇之夫鬼混。

sentences.english: Why is that straight women form insane crushes on gay and married men? Simple.
sentences.chinese: 为什么直人女会为男同志和有妇之夫而疯狂呢？

definition: lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
see 腳踏兩隻船|脚踏两只船[jiao3 ta4 liang3 zhi1 chuan2]
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
derailment (railway accident)/to leave the rails/fig. to overstep bounds/fig. to have an extramarital affair
mistress/the other woman (coll.)/grade 3 in elementary school
to carry on a clandestine love affair
